quotes.author: Isaac Newton
quotes.quote: If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.
quotes.meaning: Recognition that scientific progress is cumulative and depends on past thinkers.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: If we knew what we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?
quotes.meaning: Research is inherently exploratory—uncertainty is part of the process.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
quotes.meaning: Creative insight often leads discovery more than existing facts.

quotes.author: Stephen Hawking
quotes.quote: One, remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet.
quotes.meaning: Curiosity about the universe gives perspective beyond daily concerns.

quotes.author: Galileo Galilei
quotes.quote: Measure what is measurable, and make measurable what is not so.
quotes.meaning: Quantification is central to transforming observations into science.

quotes.author: Louis Pasteur
quotes.quote: Chance favors the prepared mind.
quotes.meaning: Opportunities in science arise when one is ready to perceive them.

quotes.author: Charles Darwin
quotes.quote: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge.
quotes.meaning: Overconfidence usually arises from limited understanding, not from deep insight.

quotes.author: Marie Curie
quotes.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood.
quotes.meaning: Fear diminishes when we investigate and comprehend what concerns us.

quotes.author: René Descartes
quotes.quote: Cogito, ergo sum.
quotes.meaning: The act of thinking proves one’s own existence.

quotes.author: Immanuel Kant
quotes.quote: Thoughts without content are empty; intuitions without concepts are blind.
quotes.meaning: We need both empirical input and conceptual structure to think meaningfully.

quotes.author: Aristotle
quotes.quote: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
quotes.meaning: Systems can exhibit features that do not reduce to their elements.

quotes.author: Seneca
quotes.quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
quotes.meaning: Our anxieties often exceed actual harms—worry magnifies problems.

quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius
quotes.quote: You have power over your mind—not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
quotes.meaning: Inner mastery offers resilience against external adversity.

quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quotes.quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
quotes.meaning: Finding purpose enables endurance through hardship.

quotes.author: Karl Popper
quotes.quote: A theory that is not refutable by any conceivable event is non-scientific.
quotes.meaning: Falsifiability is a key demarcation of scientific theories.

quotes.author: Imre Lakatos
quotes.quote: Philosophy of science without history of science is empty; history of science without philosophy of science is blind.
quotes.meaning: Both philosophical reflection and historical context are needed for scientific understanding.

quotes.author: Rebecca Goldstein
quotes.quote: Philosophy is this amazing technique we've devised for getting reality to answer us back when we're getting it wrong.
quotes.meaning: Philosophy helps us test and correct our assumptions about the world.

quotes.author: Richard Feynman
quotes.quote: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself—and you are the easiest person to fool.
quotes.meaning: Self-deception is a major obstacle; skepticism toward one’s own reasoning is vital.

quotes.author: Paul Dirac
quotes.quote: [Philosophy is] just a way of talking about discoveries that have already been made.
quotes.meaning: Some scientists see philosophy as retrospective commentary rather than forward inquiry.

quotes.author: Steven Weinberg
quotes.quote: The philosophy of science is just about as useful to scientists as ornithology is to birds.
quotes.meaning: A witty criticism: philosophy may seem irrelevant to the practice of science.
